Class CertificateUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.crypt.CertificateUtil
public final class CertificateUtil extends Object
Utility class for certificate operations.

  • Method Details

    • createSelfSignedX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate[] createSelfSignedX509Certificate(KeyPair keyPair, String subject, int validityDays, boolean enableCA) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Creates a self-signed X.509 certificate using the provided key pair, subject distinguished name, validity duration, and a flag to enable Certificate Authority (CA) settings.
      Parameters:
      keyPair - the key pair containing the private key used to sign the certificate and the public key embedded within the certificate
      subject - the distinguished name (DN) of the certificate's subject, formatted as a standard X.500 DN string (e.g., "CN=Subject, O=Organization, C=Country")
      validityDays - the number of days from the current date for which the certificate will be valid
      enableCA - a boolean flag indicating whether the certificate should include settings for acting as a Certificate Authority (CA). If true, the certificate will be configured as a CA.
      Returns:
      an array of X.509 certificates, with the first certificate being the newly created self-signed certificate. The array may include additional certificates if the chain requires it.
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs during the certificate generation or signing process

    • createSelfSignedX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate[] createSelfSignedX509Certificate(AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, int keySize, String subject, int validityDays, boolean enableCA) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Creates a self-signed X.509 certificate generating the key pair from the provided key type and size.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the algorithm to use
      keySize - the key size in bits (RSA/DSA: >=2048, EC: 256/384/521)
      subject - the distinguished name (DN) of the certificate's subject
      validityDays - the number of days the certificate will be valid
      enableCA - whether to include CA extensions
      Returns:
      an array containing the generated self-signed certificate (and optional chain elements)
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation or certificate creation fails

    • createX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate[] createX509Certificate(KeyPair keyPair, String subject, int validityDays, boolean enableCA, PrivateKey parentPrivateKey, X509Certificate... parentCertificateChain) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Creates an X.509 certificate using the provided key pair, subject distinguished name, validity period, and a parent certificate. The generated certificate is included in a chain along with the specified parent certificate(s).
      Parameters:
      keyPair - the key pair containing the private key used to sign the certificate and the public key embedded within the certificate
      subject - the distinguished name (DN) of the certificate's subject, formatted as a standard X.500 DN string (e.g., "CN=Subject, O=Organization, C=Country")
      validityDays - the number of days from the current date for which the certificate will be valid
      enableCA - a boolean flag indicating whether the certificate should include settings for acting as a Certificate Authority (CA). If true, the certificate will be configured as a CA.
      parentPrivateKey - the parent certificate's private key
      parentCertificateChain - the parent X.509 certificate to include in the generated certificate's chain, establishing a chain of trust
      Returns:
      an array of X.509 certificates, with the first certificate being the newly created certificate, followed by the specified parent certificate(s) in the chain
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs during the certificate generation or signing process

    • createX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate[] createX509Certificate(AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, int keySize, String subject, int validityDays, boolean enableCA, PrivateKey parentPrivateKey, X509Certificate... parentCertificateChain) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Creates an X.509 certificate generating the subject key pair from the provided key type and size.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the algorithm to use
      keySize - the key size in bits (RSA/DSA: >=2048, EC: 256/384/521)
      subject - the distinguished name (DN) of the certificate's subject
      validityDays - the number of days from the current date for which the certificate will be valid
      enableCA - whether to include CA extensions on the child certificate
      parentPrivateKey - the parent certificate's private key
      parentCertificateChain - the parent certificate chain used for signing
      Returns:
      the generated certificate chain with the new certificate at position 0
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation or certificate creation fails

    • toX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate toX509Certificate(byte[] bytes) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Converts a byte array representing an encoded X.509 certificate into an X509Certificate object.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the byte array containing the X.509 certificate data in DER-encoded format
      Returns:
      an X509Certificate object representing the parsed certificate
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs while parsing the certificate, such as if the byte array does not represent a valid X.509 certificate

    • readX509Certificate

      public static X509Certificate readX509Certificate(InputStream in) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Reads and parses an X.509 certificate from the provided input stream.
      Parameters:
      in - the input stream containing the DER-encoded X.509 certificate data
      Returns:
      an X509Certificate object representing the parsed certificate
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs while parsing the certificate or if the provided data is not a valid X.509 certificate

    • verifyCertificateChain

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Certificate> void verifyCertificateChain(T... certificates) throws CertificateException
      Verifies the validity of a given X.509 certificate chain. For each certificate in the chain, this method ensures that it is signed by the subsequent certificate in the chain.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic certificate type
      Parameters:
      certificates - an array of X509Certificate objects representing the certificate chain. The first certificate in the array should be the leaf certificate, followed by the intermediate certificates, and the last certificate should be the root certificate.
      Throws:
      CertificateException - if the chain is invalid, such as when a certificate is not signed by the next certificate in the chain or has other verification errors.

    • toPem

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Certificate> String toPem(T... certificates)
      Converts one or more certificates into their PEM-encoded string representation.

      Note: Most tools only support X509 certificates

      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic certificate type
      Parameters:
      certificates - one or more X509 certificates to be converted to PEM format
      Returns:
      a string containing the PEM-encoded representation of the provided certificates
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an unexpected I/O exception happens during the operation

    • parsePem

      public static Certificate parsePem(String pem) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Parses a PEM-encoded string and converts it into an X.509 Certificate.
      Parameters:
      pem - the PEM-encoded string representing the certificate
      Returns:
      the X.509 Certificate object parsed from the input string
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs during the parsing of the certificate

    • writeCertChainToPem

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Certificate, U extends Appendable> U writeCertChainToPem(U app, T... certificates) throws IOException
      Writes a PEM-encoded representation of a certificate chain to the provided Appendable. Each certificate in the chain is written enclosed between "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----" and "-----END CERTIFICATE-----" markers.

      Note: Most tools only support X509 certificates

      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic certificate type*
      U - the generic type of the Appendable used for output
      Parameters:
      app - the Writer used to write the PEM-encoded certificates. The writer must be initialized prior to calling this method, and the caller is responsible for closing the writer after use.
      certificates - a varargs array of X509Certificate objects representing the certificate chain to be written. Each certificate in the array is encoded and written in the order specified.
      Returns:
      the appendable used for output
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the writer.

    • writeCertChainToPem

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Certificate> void writeCertChainToPem(Writer writer, T... certificates) throws IOException
      Writes the provided certificates in PEM format to the specified writer. Supports X.509 certificates and logs a warning for non-X.509 certificate types.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of certificates, must extend Certificate.
      Parameters:
      writer - the writer to which the PEM-formatted certificates will be written.
      certificates - the certificates to be written in PEM format. May include one or more certificates.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the provided writer.

    • writeCertChainToPem

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Certificate> void writeCertChainToPem(OutputStream out, T... certificates) throws IOException
      Writes the provided certificates in PEM format to the specified writer. Supports X.509 certificates and logs a warning for non-X.509 certificate types.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of certificates, must extend Certificate.
      Parameters:
      out - the OutputStream to which the PEM-formatted certificates will be written.
      certificates - the certificates to be written in PEM format. May include one or more certificates.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the provided writer.

    • readCertChainFromPem

      public static Certificate[] readCertChainFromPem(Reader reader) throws IOException
      Reads X.509 certificates from a PEM-encoded input provided by a Reader.
      Parameters:
      reader - the Reader instance pointing to the PEM-encoded input
      Returns:
      an array of Certificate objects extracted from the PEM input
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error while reading the input or parsing the certificates

    • readCertChainFromPem

      public static Certificate[] readCertChainFromPem(InputStream in) throws IOException
      Reads X.509 certificates from a PEM-encoded input provided by a Reader.
      Parameters:
      in - the InputStream instance providing the PEM-encoded input
      Returns:
      an array of Certificate objects extracted from the PEM input
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error while reading the input or parsing the certificates

    • readCertChainFromPem

      public static Certificate[] readCertChainFromPem(String pem)
      Reads PEM-encoded certificate data and returns an array of Certificates.
      Parameters:
      pem - the PEM-encoded string containing certificate data
      Returns:
      an array of Certificate objects parsed from the provided PEM string

    • toPkcs7Bytes

      public static byte[] toPkcs7Bytes(Certificate... certificates) throws CertificateException
      Converts an array of certificates into a byte array in PKCS#7 format.
      Parameters:
      certificates - an array of certificates to be converted
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the certificates encoded in PKCS#7 format
      Throws:
      CertificateException - if an error occurs during certificate processing

    • parsePkcs7Bytes

      public static Certificate[] parsePkcs7Bytes(byte[] pkcs7Bytes) throws CertificateException
      Converts a byte array representing certificates into an array of Certificate objects.
      Parameters:
      pkcs7Bytes - the byte array containing the encoded certificates
      Returns:
      an array of Certificate objects generated from the provided byte array
      Throws:
      CertificateException - if an error occurs while creating the certificates

    • toPkiPathBytes

      public static byte[] toPkiPathBytes(Certificate... certificates) throws CertificateException
      Converts the given array of certificates into a byte array encoded in the PkiPath format.
      Parameters:
      certificates - an array of Certificate objects to be encoded. The certificates must be ordered with the target certificate followed by its issuing certificates, ending with the root certificate.
      Returns:
      a byte array representing the PkiPath encoding of the provided certificates.
      Throws:
      CertificateException - if an error occurs during the encoding process.

    • parsePkiPathBytes

      public static Certificate[] parsePkiPathBytes(byte[] pkcs7Bytes) throws CertificateException
      Converts a PKI Path encoded byte array into an array of Certificate objects.
      Parameters:
      pkcs7Bytes - the byte array containing the PKI Path encoded certificate chain.
      Returns:
      an array of Certificate objects extracted from the provided byte array.
      Throws:
      CertificateException - if the byte array cannot be decoded into a valid certificate chain.

    • isSelfSigned

      public static boolean isSelfSigned(X509Certificate cert) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Checks if the given X509 certificate is self-signed.

      A certificate is considered self-signed if its issuer and subject are the same and its signature can be verified with its own public key.

      Parameters:
      cert - the X509 certificate to check
      Returns:
      true if the certificate is self-signed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if an error occurs during the signature verification process
